source.name: Oracles and Smart Contracts
source.instructions: Which of the following statements accurately describe the relationship between oracles and smart contracts in blockchain ecosystems? Select all that apply.

answers.answer: Oracles enable smart contracts to access off-chain data
Smart contracts can directly interact with external data sources without oracles
Oracles act as middleware between on-chain and off-chain environments
The use of oracles compromises the security of blockchain networks
Oracles expand the potential applications of smart contracts

source.guidance: Oracles play a crucial role in expanding the capabilities of smart contracts by enabling them to access off-chain data, which is correct. They act as middleware, facilitating communication between on-chain and off-chain environments, which is also accurate. By providing external data to smart contracts, oracles indeed expand their potential applications. However, smart contracts cannot directly interact with external data sources without oracles; this limitation is precisely why oracles are necessary. Lastly, while oracles introduce some additional considerations for security, they do not inherently compromise the security of blockchain networks when implemented properly.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT evaluate the role and importance of oracles in blockchain ecosystems
